Overview
Before installing the NCC, ensure that you have read and completed all the preliminary steps outlined in that chapter.
This section describes the workflow of the NCC installation in VMware. The NCC is deployed on one Organization Virtual Data Center (VDC).
The minimum NCC deployment is one SM site (VNF) and one ME site (VNF), or one IG site (VNF).
To install the NCC in VMware:

step.cmd: Contact Nokia Professional services to obtain the following:

li.p: VMDK images
CSAR packages
Scalable files
VNF Extension files
OVF files
MD5 files
For instructions on how to generate the CSAR packages, the Scalable files and the VNF Extension files, see the NCC VNF Artifacts Generator Tool User Guide.
For information on the Scalable files, see the NCC VNF Artifacts Generator Tool User Guide. The Scalable files cannot be manually updated since they are automatically generated.
For information on the VNF Extension files, see section .

For more information on standard lifecycle management and VNF maintenance operations in CBAM such as uploading CSAR packages, creating, modifying and instantiating a VNF, see CloudBand Application Manager (CBAM) documentation in the Nokia Discovery Center by going to https://doc.networks.nokia.com

note.p: Put the OVF files and the VMDK images into the same specified path on the vCloud VM.

li.p: VMDK images
CSAR packages
Scalable files
VNF Extension files
OVF files
MD5 files

step.cmd: Using the instructions in Nokia Support Portal, verify the downloaded VMDK images and files by generating MD5 hash values and comparing the generated values with the values provided in Support Portal and in MD5 files. The generated MD5 hash values, the MD5 hash values in Support Portal and the values in MD5 files must match. If you find discrepancies, download the VMDK images and files again. For more information on the images, see .

note.p: In addition to MD5 values, Nokia provides SHA-256 hash values. The NCC does not use SHA-256 hash values for image verification.

Log in to the CBAM GUI and upload the CSAR packages for this deployment using the procedure .

note.p: All the parameters in the VNF Extension file, including <sdc_config_data> parameter, must be updated before instantiation if you are installing the NCC and before SU if you are upgrading the NCC. If a parameter or a group of parameters can be updated post-instantiate and post-SU, the NCC documentation outlines this information.
